para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:14px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.46; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:10pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: If you are creating sizeable applets that make use of many large binary packages, it's possible that the load times for these packages could become onerous since they must be imported into the plug-in

each time an applet is started. In such situations, the ability to deploy your own customised version of the plug-in, with a number of packages preloaded, might prove useful. The ability to create a custom plug-in is provided by an additional package;

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:10pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:14px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.46; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:10pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: The plug-in builder introduces a single new class called

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:10pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: for deploying plug-in images. You will find that a pre-initialized instance of this class been installed into the builder package as the default image stripper.

para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:14px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.46; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:10pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

font-family:Verdana; font-size:10pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: and a standard stripper is the ability to name a base set of required packages that must be present in the deployed image. This set is specified in the method

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:10pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: . Before you choose to deploy a custom plug-in you should edit this method to answer the packages that you wish to remain in the final image. To start the stripping process, right click over the

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:10pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

font-family:Verdana; font-size:10pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: from the context menu. This will bring up the
and you can start the deployment process as normal. The end result is a new NPDolphin.DLL containing the plug-in start-up code and your chosen stripped image.

para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:14px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.46; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: Tip: You'll notice in the deployment wizard that the plug-in image stripper has been pre-configured not to remove unreferenced classes and methods during the stripping process. This is important since you do not want your plug-in image to contain only partially complete classes.
